importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Col Michael Randrianirina was sworn in as head of state on this date, marking a pivotal moment in Madagascar's political transition following the military takeover.
The article was published on this date, reflecting the ongoing political tension and public response to the appointment of the new prime minister.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Protests began almost a month ago, starting on or around October 1, 2025, and continued through the period leading up to the military takeover and the appointment of the new PM.

keyTakeAways: Gen Z Mada, a youth-led protest movement, opposes the appointment of Herintsalama Rajaonarivelo as prime minister, citing lack of transparency and non-consensual decision-making.
The new head of state, Col Michael Randrianirina, led a military coup and was sworn in on 17 October 2025, after President Andry Rajoelina went into hiding following failed dialogue efforts.
Gen Z Mada claims that Rajaonarivelo's appointment contradicts the movement's goal of structural political change and demands explanation of his selection process.
The protests originated due to frequent water and power outages, but evolved into broader demands for political reform and accountability.
Gen Z Mada asserts that the youth will continue to monitor and mobilize against what they see as a reversal of democratic and structural change.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In Madagascar, youth-led protests have driven political change, culminating in the removal of President Andry Rajoelina and the military takeover led by Col Michael Randrianirina, who was sworn in on 17 October 2025. In response, the Gen Z Mada movement has strongly criticized the appointment of businessman Herintsalama Rajaonarivelo as prime minister, accusing it of being made without transparency or consultation—contrary to the youth movement's goal of structural political reform. The protests initially began due to water and power outages but expanded into broader demands for accountability and democratic change. Gen Z Mada insists on full transparency in the selection of Rajaonarivelo and vows to continue monitoring and mobilizing if the process is not justified.
title: Madagascar Gen Z protesters angry at choice of new PM Rajaonarivelo
